Function Documentation

sx_status_t sx_api_port_log_verbosity_level_set ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_access_cmd_t  cmd,
const sx_log_verbosity_target_t  verbosity_target,
sx_verbosity_level_t *  module_verbosity_level_p,
sx_verbosity_level_t *  api_verbosity_level_p 
)

This function sets the log verbosity level of PORT MODULE

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] cmd - SET / GET
[in] verbosity_target - set get verbosity of : API / MODULE / BOTH
[in,out] module_verbosity_level_p - PORT module verbosity level
[in,out] api_verbosity_level_p - PORT API verbosity level
Returns:
SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_PARAM_ERROR if any input parameters is invalid

SX_STATUS_ERROR general error

sx_status_t sx_api_port_device_set ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_access_cmd_t  cmd,
const uint8_t  config_hw,
const sx_device_id_t  device_id,
const sx_mac_addr_t *  base_mac_addr_p,
const sx_port_mode_t *  port_mode_list_p,
const sx_port_mapping_t *  port_mapping_list_p,
sx_port_log_id_t *  log_port_list_p,
const length_t  port_cnt 
)

This API Adds/Deletes a device to/from the SDK. A device may have different port width when using a single/double/quad lanes to provide 10/20/40GE. The mapping is done between the Local Port identifier & the module (cage) identifier that hosts this port. The SDK maps the device's Local Ports to (unique) logical ports that represents SDK's ports.

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle.
[in] cmd - ADD/DELETE.
[in] config_hw - Configure HW Flag (for native "Ethernet only" system).!!! not supported yet - always set to 0 !!!.
[in] device_id - Device ID.
[in] base_mac_addr_p - Device base MAC address pointer.
[in] port_mode_list_p - Ports Mode list.
[in] port_mapping_list_p - Ports Mapping list.
[out] log_port_list_p - Logical Port ID list.
[in] port_cnt - Lists' length.
Returns:
sx_status_t:

SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_PARAM_NULL: Pointer is NULL.

SX_STATUS_PARAM_EXCEEDS_RANGE: Parameters exceeds range.

SX_STATUS_CMD_UNSUPPORTED: Access Command isn't supported.

sx_status_t sx_api_port_device_get ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_device_id_t  device_id,
const sx_swid_id_t  swid_id,
sx_port_mode_t *  port_mode_list_p,
sx_port_mapping_t *  port_mapping_list_p,
sx_port_log_id_t *  log_port_list_p,
length_t *  port_cnt_p 
)

* This API Retrieves a device information (port lists) from the SDK. If all optional output buffers are NULL - this API simply retrieves the number of ports.

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] device_id - Device ID
[in] swid_id - SwID ID (use SX_SWID_ID_DONTCARE to get all ports)
[out] port_mode_list - Ports Mode list.
[out] port_mapping_list - Ports Mapping list.
[out] log_port_list - Logical Port ID list.
[in,out] port_cnt_p - IN: Ports Lists' length.****** OUT:****** Ports Number.
Returns:
sx_status_t:

SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_PARAM_NULL: Pointer is NULL.

SX_STATUS_PARAM_EXCEEDS_RANGE: Parameters exceeds range.

sx_status_t sx_api_port_swid_set ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_access_cmd_t  cmd,
const sx_swid_t  swid_id 
)

This API Adds/Deletes a SwID to/from the SDK. A SwID which has binded ports, cannot be deleted.

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] cmd - ADD/DELETE
[in] swid_id - Switch ID
Returns:
sx_status_t:

SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_PARAM_ERROR: Input parameters error.

SX_STATUS_PARAM_EXCEEDS_RANGE: swid exceeds range or**** undefined in profile

SX_STATUS_MESSAGE_SIZE_EXCEEDS_LIMIT: Message size error.

SX_STATUS_CMD_UNSUPPORTED: Unsupported command.

sx_status_t sx_api_port_swid_list_get ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
sx_swid_id_t *  swid_list_p,
length_t *  swid_cnt_p 
)

This API retrieves all SwIDs list from the SDK. If optional output buffer is NULL - this API simply retrieves the number of SwIDs.

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[out] swid_list - Array of SwIDs
[in,out] swid_cnt_p - In: Array's length. Out:***** Number***** of***** SwIDs
Returns:
sx_status_t:

SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_PARAM_ERROR: Input parameters error.

SX_STATUS_MESSAGE_SIZE_ZERO: Message size error.

SX_STATUS_MESSAGE_SIZE_EXCEEDS_LIMIT: Message size error.

SX_STATUS_PARAM_EXCEEDS_RANGE: SwIDs list length is 0 (zero).

SX_STATUS_MESSAGE_SIZE_EXCEEDS_LIMIT: Message size error.

SX_STATUS_PARAM_EXCEEDS_RANGE: SwIDs out of range.

sx_status_t sx_api_port_swid_bind_set ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_port_log_id_t  log_port,
const sx_swid_id_t  swid_id 
)

This API Binds/UN-binds a logical port to / from a SWID in the SDK.

In order to unbind a port from swid , the swid field should be SX_SWID_ID_DISABLED

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] log_port - Logical Port ID
[in] swid_id - New Switch Partition ID.
Returns:
sx_status_t:

SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_MESSAGE_SIZE_ZERO: Message size error.

SX_STATUS_MESSAGE_SIZE_EXCEEDS_LIMIT: Message size error.

SX_STATUS_PARAM_EXCEEDS_RANGE: SwIDs out of range.

sx_status_t sx_api_port_swid_bind_get ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_port_log_id_t  log_port,
sx_swid_t *  swid_id_p 
)

sx_status_t sx_api_port_mode_set ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_port_log_id_t  log_port,
const sx_port_mode_t  mode 
)

This API is not supported at the current release

This API Sets the Port's Stacking Mode in the SDK.

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] log_port - Logical Port ID.
[in] mode - new Port Mode.
Returns:
sx_status_t:

SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_MESSAGE_SIZE_ZERO: Message size error.

SX_STATUS_MESSAGE_SIZE_EXCEEDS_LIMIT: Message size error.

SX_STATUS_INVALID_HANDLE: Invalid Handle.

sx_status_t sx_api_port_speed_admin_set ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_port_log_id_t  log_port,
const sx_port_speed_capability_t *  admin_speed_p 
)

This API Sets the Port Type & Speed. It enables the application to set the port enabled mode(s). When link is up, the current active protocol is retrieved (after SET). When link is down, the supported protocols are retrieved (after SET).

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] log_port - Logical Port ID
[in] admin_speed_p - New Types & Speeds (protocols)**** enabled
Returns:
sx_status_t:

SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_MESSAGE_SIZE_ZERO: Message size error

SX_STATUS_MESSAGE_SIZE_EXCEEDS_LIMIT: Message size error

SX_STATUS_PARAM_ERROR: Input parameters error

SX_STATUS_PARAM_NULL: NULL pointer error

SX_STATUS_INVALID_HANDLE: Invalid Handle

sx_status_t sx_api_port_flow_ctrl_pause_set ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_port_log_id_t  log_port,
const sx_port_flow_ctrl_mode_t  fc_mode 
)

This API Sets the Port Flow Control Pause Configuration

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] log_port - Logical Port ID (whose flow control configuration to set)
[in] fc_mode - enum which represent tx/rx Flow Control state. ENUM sets the mode of both RX & TX with one of 4 possible EN/DIS combinations
Returns:
SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_PARAM_NULL: NULL parameter received.

SX_STATUS_MESSAGE_SIZE_ZERO: Message size error.

SX_STATUS_MESSAGE_SIZE_EXCEEDS_LIMIT: Message size error.

)

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] log_port - logical port id
[in] traffic_class - traffic class id
[out] cntr_p - per port per TC counters Note: The API does not support LAG
Returns:
sx_status_t:

SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_PARAM_ERROR if Invalid parameter was supplied

SX_STATUS_INVALID_HANDLE if handle is NULL

SX_STATUS_PARAM_NULL if one of the parameter is NULL

SX_STATUS_ERROR otherwise

const sx_port_log_id_t  log_port,

)

[out] cntr_ext_p - extended counters entry.

sx_status_t sx_api_port_cntr_clear_set ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_port_log_id_t  log_port,
const boolean_t  all_ports,
const sx_port_cntr_grp_t  cntr_grp 
)

This API clear Port Counters. The user has the following options :

1. clear a specific port (set log_port field with the log port ID && all_ports = FALSE) : option a. clear specific counter group (set the group in cntr_grp). option b. clear all counter groups (set cntr_grp = SX_PORT_CNTR_GRP_ALL)

2. clear all ports (set all_ports = TRUE) : option a. clear specific counter group (set the group in cntr_grp). option b. clear all counter groups (set cntr_grp = SX_PORT_CNTR_GRP_ALL)

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] log_port - Logical Port ID.
[in] all_ports - Clear all ports counters
[in] cntr_grp - Performance counter group.
Returns:
SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_MESSAGE_SIZE_ZERO: Message size error.

SX_STATUS_MESSAGE_SIZE_EXCEEDS_LIMIT: Message size error.

SX_STATUS_COMM_ERROR: Commiunication error - send fail.

SX_STATUS_INVALID_HANDLE: Invalid Handle.

const sx_port_log_id_t  log_port 
)

sx_status_t sx_api_port_policer_bind_set ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_access_cmd_t  cmd,
const sx_port_log_id_t  log_port,
const sx_policer_id_t  policer_id,
const sx_port_policer_flow_metering_type_t *  flow_metering_p 
)

This API Binds / Un-binds a policer to / from a port Cannot bind policer to LAG member port

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] cmd - SX_ACCESS_CMD_BIND: bind a policer to a port and set the flow metering map. SX_ACCESS_CMD_UNBIND: unbind a policer from a port
[in] log_port - Logical Port ID
[in] policer_id - Policer ID
[in] flow_metering_p - Pointer to the flow map of a port-policer pair
Returns:
sx_status_t:

SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_PARAM_EXCEEDS_RANGE if any input parameter is invalid

SX_STATUS_SXD_RETURNED_NON_ZERO in case of HW failure

SX_STATUS_CMD_UNSUPPORTED if unsupported command is requested

SX_STATUS_PARAM_NULL if NULL parameter received

const sx_port_log_id_t  log_port,
const sx_policer_id_t  policer_id,
sx_port_policer_flow_metering_type_t *  flow_metering_p 
)

sx_status_t sx_api_port_sflow_set ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_access_cmd_t  cmd,
const sx_port_log_id_t  log_port,
sx_port_sflow_params_t *  sflow_params_p 
)

This API controls sFlow state of the port. Using access cmd CREATE a sFlow sampling is defined on port, then after it is set user may EDIT the sflow parameters of a configured port. In order to remove sFlow sampling from the port use access cmd DESTROY.

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] cmd - access cmd (CREATE/DESTROY/EDIT)
[in] log_port - Logical Port ID.
[in,out] sflow_params_p - sFlow related configuration params(Deviation>0); ignored when CMD=DESTROY. The api will return the sFlow params configured in practice. Deviation will be returned in percentage.
It is highly recommanded to always check the deviation value returned.

Returns:
sx_status_t:

SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_NO_RESOURCES if out of resources for sFlow policer

SX_STATUS_PARAM_EXCEEDS_RANGE if parameter supplied exceeds supported values.

SX_STATUS_PARAM_ERROR if Invalid parameter was supplied

SX_STATUS_PARAM_NULL if one of the parameter is NULL

SX_STATUS_CMD_UNSUPPORTED if cmd is not supported

SX_STATUS_ERROR otherwise

sx_status_t sx_api_port_sflow_get ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_port_log_id_t  log_port,
sx_port_sflow_params_t *  sflow_params_p 
)

This API gets the ports sFlow state.

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] log_port - Logical Port ID.
[out] sflow_params_p - sFlow related configuration parameters
Returns:

SX_STATUS_PARAM_NULL if one of the parameter is NULL

SX_STATUS_PARAM_EXCEEDS_RANGE if parameter supplied exceeds supported values.

SX_STATUS_PARAM_ERROR if Invalid parameter was supplied

SX_STATUS_ERROR otherwise

sx_status_t sx_api_port_isolate_set ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_access_cmd_t  access_cmd,
const sx_port_log_id_t  log_port,
const sx_port_log_id_t *  log_port_list_p,
const length_t  log_port_cnt 
)

This function sets the isolation group of the port (a list of ports from which traffic should not be transmitted to log_port). Isolation is supported only between ports on the same device, and on the same SWID. Set - add ports to isolation group (overwrites previous configuration) Add - add ports to isolation group (additionally to previous configuration) Delete - remove ports from isolation group Delete All - empty isolation group

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] access_cmd - SET/ADD/DELETE/DELETE_ALL
[in] log_port - Logical Port ID.
[in] log_port_list_p - list of logical ports
[in] log_port_cnt - number of logical ports in the list
Returns:
SX_STATUS_SUCCESS - Operation completes successfully.

SX_STATUS_PARAM_NULL - Parameter is unexpectedly NULL.

SX_STATUS_PARAM_ERROR - Parameter is invalid.

SX_STATUS_ENTRY_NOT_FOUND - Requested element is not found in DB.

SX_STATUS_PARAM_EXCEEDS_RANGE - Parameter exceeds its range.

sx_status_t sx_api_port_isolate_get ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_port_log_id_t  log_port,
sx_port_log_id_t *  log_port_list_p,
length_t *  log_port_cnt_p 
)

This function retrieves the isolation group of the port (a list of ports from which traffic should not be transmitted to log_port).

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] log_port - Logical Port ID.
[in,out] log_port_list_p - list of logical ports
[in,out] log_port_cnt_p - In: Number of Logical Ports in list, Out: Number of Logical Ports in LAG. Use log_port_num=0 to retrieve only the size of isolation group.
Returns:
SX_STATUS_SUCCESS - Operation completes successfully.

SX_STATUS_PARAM_NULL - Parameter is unexpectedly NULL.

SX_STATUS_PARAM_ERROR - Parameter is invalid.

SX_STATUS_ENTRY_NOT_FOUND - Requested element is not found in DB.

SX_STATUS_PARAM_EXCEEDS_RANGE - Parameter exceeds its range.

sx_status_t sx_api_port_swid_type_get ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_swid_id_t  swid,
sx_swid_type_t *  swid_type_p 
)

This API returns the swid type as it was configured in the profile, at SDK init time.

Parameters:
swid - Switch Partition ID.
swid_type - DISABLED/ETHERNET/INFINIBAND
Returns:
SX_STATUS_SUCCESS - Operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_PARAM_EXCEEDS_RANGE - Parameter exceeds its range.
